00029     # @type self: A logging logger instance
00030     # @param self: A previously defined logger. Crab log messages will use this logger as their parent logger.
00031     def __init__(self, logger = None):
00032         self.workingArea = os.getcwd()
00033         self.dry_run = False
00034         if logger is not None:
00035             self.logger = logger.getChild("CrabController")
00036         else:
00037             # add instance logger as logger to root
00038             self.logger = logging.getLogger("CrabController")
00039             # check if handlers are present for root logger
00040             # we assume that the default logging is not configured
00041             # if handler is present
00042             if len(logging.getLogger().handlers) < 1 :
00043                 logging.basicConfig( level=logging._levelNames[ 'DEBUG' ])
00044                 
00045                 # create console handler and set level to debug
00046                 ch = logging.StreamHandler()
00047                 ch.setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
00048                 # create formatter
00049                 formatter = logging.Formatter( '%(asctime)s - %(name)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s' )
00050                 
00051                 # add formatter to ch
00052                 ch.setFormatter(formatter)
00053                 
00054                 # add ch to logger
00055                 logging.getLogger().addHandler(ch)
00056

00207     ## Prints log message either to logging object if given or print log message to prompt
00208     #
00209     # @type crablog A logging object instance 
00210     # @param crablog Logging object where function adds log messages. Messages
00211     #                 are sent to the prompt if no log object is specified.  
00212     # @type message string
00213     # @param message  Message which should be written to lof
00214     # @type logtype string
00215     # @param logtype log category for this message (info,error,warning)
00216     def conditionalLog(crablog,message,logtype="info"):
00217         for basetype in ['info','warning','error']:
00218             if basetype in logtype:
00219                 try:
00220                     logToCall = getattr(crablog, basetype)
00221                     logToCall(message)
00222                 except:
00223                     print "%s: %s"%(basetype,message)

00232     ## Populates an existing optparse parser or returns a new one with options for crab functions
00233 >>>>>>> crabLogging
00234     #
00235     # This functions populates a previously created (or new) instance of a
00236     # optparse parser object with options needed by crab functions.
00237     # It is possible to add three kinds of options:
00238     # - options where a error should be raised if the option was previously defined
00239     # - options where previous definitions should be kept
00240     # - options where previous definitions should be overriden
00241     # @type Optparse parser instance
00242     # @param parser A previously created parser oject which should be extenden [default: new instance]
00243     # @return A new or extenden optparse parser instance    
00244     def crab_commandlineOptions(parser = optparse.OptionParser( 'usage: %prog' )):
00245         # we first need to call parse_args with a dummy string at the beginning to
00246         # check for existing options later
00247         (currentoptions, args ) = parser.parse_args([" "])
00248         
00249         # The following block shows how variables should be added, where
00250         # conflicts are possible if the option is overridden by this function
00251         # they raise a value error
00252         #try:
00253         #    parser.add_option( '--someOption',metavar='DIR',default=None,
00254         #                       help='Dummy option for future integration') 
00255         #except OptionConflictError as e:
00256         #    conditionalLog(crablog,"There are conflicts extending the optparse options object",'error')
00257         #    conditionalLog(crablog,e.strerror,'error')
00258           
00259         # options where it is checked if they exists and new options are added
00260         # otherwise
00261         if not hasattr(currentoptions, 'dry_run'):
00262             parser.add_option( '--dry-run', action='store_true', default=False, 
00263                             help='Do everything except calling CRAB or registering samples to the database.' )
00264         if not hasattr(currentoptions, 'workingArea'):
00265             parser.add_option( '--workingArea',metavar='DIR',default=os.getcwd(),help='The area (full or relative path) where to create the CRAB project directory. ' 
00266                                  'If the area doesn\'t exist, CRAB will try to create it using the mkdir command' \
00267                                 ' (without -p option). Defaults to the current working directory.'       )
00268     
00269             
00270         # Some options can be added without expected trouble with other parser
00271         # parts, simply because it is quite fixed what they represent.
00272         # those variables should be added here and will throw no exception if
00273         # they already exist in the parser
00274         #parser.set_conflict_handler('resolve')
00275         #parser.add_option( '--someOption',metavar='DIR',default=None,
00276         #                       help='Dummy option for future integration') 
00277             
00278         return parser
